results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE d.name = 'Sales' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2024;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, AVG(e.salary) AS avg_salary FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.* FROM customers c WHERE c.credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT o.* FROM sales_orders o WHERE o.status = 'pending') AS pending_orders LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM products AS p JOIN product_categories AS pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.name FROM warehouses w LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.* FROM vendors v WHERE v.is_active = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT acc_type.name FROM account_types acc_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT b.account_number, b.bank_name, b.current_balance FROM bank_accounts b LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT f.asset_id, a.name, f.purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets AS f JOIN asset_categories AS a ON f.category_id = a.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT lt.name FROM leave_types AS lt LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT tc.name AS course_name, tc.duration_hours, tc.cost, tc.is_mandatory FROM employee_training et JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT o.name AS stage_name FROM sales_opportunities s JOIN opportunity_stages o ON s.stage_id = o.stage_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.name FROM countries AS c LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT uom.name AS unit_measurement, uom.abbreviation FROM units_of_measure uom LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT fy.year FROM fiscal_years fy LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT f.category_id, a.name FROM fixed_assets AS f JOIN asset_categories AS a ON f.category_id = a.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE e.hire_date <= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '5 year' AND s.amount > 100000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS employee_full_name, m.first_name || ' ' || m.last_name AS manager_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name AS first_name FROM employees e INNER JOIN leave_requests lr ON e.employee_id = lr.employee_id WHERE lr.status = 'pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title AS PositionTitle, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS NumberOfEmployees FROM positions p JOIN employees e ON p.position_id = e.position_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employee_salaries s JOIN employees e ON s.employee_id = e.employee_id JOIN employee_certifications c ON e.employee_id = c.employee_id WHERE c.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '6 months') GROUP BY e.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, SUM(sales_orders.subtotal) AS total_sales_amount FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders ON c.customer_id = sales_orders.customer_id WHERE YEAR(sales_orders.order_date) = 2024 GROUP BY c.customer_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: function year(date) does not exist

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, c.name, SUM(po.total) AS total_order_value FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders so ON c.customer_id = so.customer_id JOIN purchase_orders po ON so.order_id = po.po_id GROUP BY c.customer_id ORDER BY total_order_value DESC LIMIT 10;

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT so.* FROM sales_opportunities so JOIN opportunity_stages os ON so.stage_id = os.stage_id WHERE os.name = 'Negotiation' AND so.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.order_id AS "Order ID", COUNT(q.quote_id) AS "Quote Count", (COUNT(q.quote_id)/SUM(s.quantity)) * 100 AS "Conversion Rate" FROM sales_orders s JOIN quote_lines q ON s.order_id = q.order_id GROUP BY s.order_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column q.order_id does not exist

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.sales_rep_id AS rep_id, COUNT(s.order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders s GROUP BY s.sales_rep_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name FROM products p INNER JOIN reorder_rules r ON p.product_id = r.product_id INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id WHERE i.quantity_available < r.min_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.warehouse_id, SUM(i.quantity * i.quantity_on_hand) AS total_inventory_value FROM inventory_levels i JOIN warehouses w ON i.warehouse_id = w.warehouse_id GROUP BY w.warehouse_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column i.quantity does not exist

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM products p INNER JOIN stock_transfers st ON p.product_id = (SELECT st.product_id FROM stock_transfers st WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days') LIMIT 1;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column st.product_id does not exist

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, SUM(vi.amount) AS total_spend FROM vendor_invoices vi JOIN vendors v ON vi.vendor_id = v.vendor_id WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM fiscal_years.start_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE) GROUP BY v.vendor_id;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT po.* FROM purchase_orders po JOIN goods_receipts gr ON po.po_id = gr.receipt_id WHERE gr.receipt_date > po.order_date AND gr.receipt_date <= NULL LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'Approved' THEN 1 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*) AS approval_rate FROM purchase_requisitions WHERE status IS NOT NULL LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.sql_generated: SELECT ca.account_number AS account_no, SUM(bt.amount) AS total_debit, SUM(ca.current_balance) AS total_credit FROM bank_accounts ca JOIN bank_transactions bt ON ca.bank_account_id = bt.bank_account_id WHERE bt.transaction_date BETWEEN (SELECT start_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE period_number = 1) AND (SELECT end_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE period_number = 1) GROUP BY ca.account_number LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error: more than one row returned by a subquery used as an expression

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated: SELECT j.entry_id, j.entry_number, j.entry_date, j.description, j.status FROM journal_entries AS j WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM CURRENT_DATE) AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE);
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, b.total_amount AS total_budget, pb.actual_amount AS actual_spending FROM budgets b JOIN departments d ON b.department_id = d.department_id LEFT JOIN project_budgets pb ON b.budget_id = pb.budget_id GROUP BY department_name, total_budget, actual_spending LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, SUM(e.amount) AS total_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses e ON p.project_id = e.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM projects AS p JOIN budgets AS b ON p.project_id = b.budget_id WHERE p.budget > b.total_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT r.role AS role_assigned, p.project_id, p.name AS project_name, r.employee_id, r.allocation_percent FROM project_resources r JOIN projects p ON r.project_id = p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.category_id, SUM(fa.purchase_cost) AS total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_categories ac ON fa.category_id = ac.category_id GROUP BY fa.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.* FROM fixed_assets AS fa JOIN asset_maintenance AS am ON fa.asset_id = am.asset_id WHERE am.completed_date IS NULL OR am.completed_date > CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days' ORDER BY fa.created_at LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.entity_type, COUNT(d.attachment_id) AS num_documents FROM document_attachments d GROUP BY d.entity_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id AND et.status = 'completed' WHERE et.course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM training_courses WHERE is_mandatory = TRUE) LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', so.order_date) AS order_month, SUM(so.subtotal) / COUNT(*) AS avg_sales_per_customer FROM sales_orders so WHERE so.ship_date IS NOT NULL AND so.status = 'Completed' GROUP BY order_month ORDER BY order_month DESC LIMIT 12;

results.question: Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.segment, AVG(sales_orders.total) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(*) / 365.0 AS order_frequency FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders ON customers.customer_id = sales_orders.customer_id GROUP BY c.segment LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated: SELECT opportunity_stages.name AS stage, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM opportunity_stages.expected_close_date) AS expected_close_month, SUM(sales_opportunities.amount * (1 - sales_opportunities.probability / 100)) OVER (PARTITION BY opportunity_stages.name ORDER BY opportunity_stages.sequence) AS weighted_value FROM sales_opportunities INNER JOIN opportunity_stages ON sales_opportunities.stage_id = opportunity_stages.id GROUP BY stage, expected_close_month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.name AS ProductCategoryName, AVG(it.turnover_ratio) AS AvgTurnoverRatio FROM (SELECT p.category_id, SUM(it.quantity)/AVG(p.unit_cost)*100 AS turnover_ratio FROM inventory_transactions it JOIN products p ON it.product_id = p.product_id GROUP BY p.category_id) it JOIN product_categories pc ON it.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.is_active = true GROUP BY pc.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, i.quantity_on_hand, a.quantity_before, a.quantity_after, ((a.quantity_before - a.quantity_after)/i.quantity_on_hand)*100 AS discrepancy_percentage FROM inventory_levels i JOIN products p ON i.product_id = p.product_id JOIN adjustment_lines a ON p.product_id = a.product_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate vendor performance score based on on-time delivery and invoice accuracy
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, AVG(CASE WHEN iv.due_date >= iv.invoice_date THEN 100 ELSE 50 END) AS performance_score FROM vendors v JOIN vendor_invoices iv ON v.vendor_id = iv.vendor_id GROUP BY v.vendor_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated: SELECT ac.name AS category, SUM(CASE WHEN da.is_debit THEN da.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debits, SUM(CASE WHEN da.is_credit THEN da.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credits FROM asset_categories ac JOIN depreciation_entries da ON ac.category_id = da.asset_id GROUP BY ac.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column da.is_debit does not exist

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date) AS month, SUM(amount * (1 - is_reconciled)) OVER (PARTITION BY transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date)) as cash_flow 
FROM bank_transactions 
JOIN bank_accounts ON bank_transactions.bank_account_id = bank_accounts.bank_account_id 
GROUP BY transaction_type, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated: SELECT pb.project_id, SUM(pb.planned_amount) AS planned_total, SUM(pe.actual_amount) AS actual_total, (SUM(pb.planned_amount) - SUM(pe.actual_amount)) AS profitability FROM project_budgets pb INNER JOIN project_expenses pe ON pb.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY pb.project_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column pe.actual_amount does not exist

results.question: Find resource allocation by employee across all active projects
results.sql_generated: SELECT pr.project_id AS project_id, pe.employee_id AS employee_id, pr.role AS role, SUM(pr.allocation_percent * 10) AS total_hours_allocated FROM project_resources pr JOIN employees pe ON pr.employee_id = pe.employee_id WHERE pe.is_active = true AND pr.project_id IN (SELECT p.project_id FROM projects p WHERE p.status = 'Active' GROUP BY p.project_id) GROUP BY pr.project_id, pe.employee_id, pr.role LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id, fa.name AS asset_name, fa.location_id, emp.employee_number, emp.first_name, emp.last_name FROM fixed_assets fa INNER JOIN employees emp ON fa.assigned_to = emp.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Create a comprehensive employee cost report including salary and benefits by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(e.salary) + COALESCE(SUM(be.amount), 0) AS total_cost FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id LEFT JOIN employee_benefits be ON e.employee_id = be.employee_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;
